abstract: A federal judge in Manhattan ruled Tuesday that it was unfair to hold Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s liable as “underwriters” on securities offerings needing their ratings.
snippet: A federal judge in Manhattan ruled Tuesday that it was unfair to hold Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s liable as “underwriters” on securities offerings needing their ratings.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Manhattan ruled Tuesday that it was unfair to hold Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s liable as “underwriters” on securities offerings needing their ratings, as he rejected fraud claims by investors on the safety of $63.4 billion of mortgage-backed debt, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Judge Rules Moody’s and S.&P. Aren’t Underwriters
